sources.title: UniFi Access Point/Switch/LTE | Releases | Ubiquiti Community

articles.author: UI-Glenn
articles.description:
Bugfixes

[UAP] Fix APs cycling between 'Getting Ready' and 'Online' continuously when Lock to AP is in-use and any AP goes down (e.g. for a firmware update). This led to all clients getting disconnected randomly.

Additional information

U6-Pro/Mesh needs to be upgraded to 5.67.0 first before upgrading to 5.68.0+.
Instead of using the manual links, you can also subscribe to your desired firmware channel, as described here.
Please refer to this article to find more details on how to identify your Access Point generation.
Your device built-in display may turn black or unresponsive for ~10 minutes after firmware upgrades to upgrade LCM firmware.
All URLs use HTTPS. This assumes your device(s) are running 3.7.56 or later and that the device's date is properly set. Please change URLs to HTTP for device(s) running earlier firmware or if the date is incorrect (e.g. if device can't reach a NTP server).

 
Any and all feedback is welcome, including lettings us know about successful device upgrades. When reporting an issue, please ensure that you include the following information:

Network Application version.
Firmware version (previous and current). 
Device model(s).
articles.title: UniFi Access Point 6.2.49

articles.author: UI-Glenn
articles.description:
Improvements

[LTE] Update LTE module.
[LTE] Update LCM messages.
[LTE] Improve LTE module firmware update process.

Additional information

Instead of using the manual links, you can also subscribe to your desired firmware channel, as described here.
All URLs use HTTPS. This assumes your device(s) are running 3.7.56 or later and that the device's date is properly set. Please change URLs to HTTP for device(s) running earlier firmware or if the date is incorrect (e.g. if device can't reach a NTP server).

 
Any and all feedback is welcome, including lettings us know about successful device upgrades. When reporting an issue, please ensure that you include the following information:

Network Application version.
Firmware version (previous and current). 
Device model(s).
articles.title: UniFi LTE 6.2.48

articles.author: UI-Glenn
articles.description:
Overview
* This release is only for Gen6 Access Points
Bugfixes

[UAP] Fix incorrect manual firmware update URL leading to the AP going offline in the Network Application.
[UAP-Gen6] Fix AP getting stuck when rebooting after a firmware update.
[UAP-Gen6] Fix Error-A12 state on APs after a firmware update, leading to various side-effects (AP getting stuck randomly, firmware updates failing, etc.).

Known issues
We have discovered an issue that causes APs to cycle between 'Getting Ready' and 'Online' repeatedly if Lock to AP is in-use, causing unstable client connectivity.
This version is being pulled from the Official release channel while we fix this.
Additional information

U6-Pro/Mesh needs to be upgraded to 5.67.0 first before upgrading to 5.68.0+.
Instead of using the manual links, you can also subscribe to your desired firmware channel, as described here.
Please refer to this article to find more details on how to identify your Access Point generation.
All URLs use HTTPS. This assumes your device(s) are running 3.7.56 or later and that the device's date is properly set. Please change URLs to HTTP for device(s) running earlier firmware or if the date is incorrect (e.g. if device can't reach a NTP server).

 
Any and all feedback is welcome, including lettings us know about successful device upgrades. When reporting an issue, please ensure that you include the following information:

Network Application version.
Firmware version (previous and current). 
Device model(s).
articles.title: UniFi Access Point 6.2.47
